data.title: Good hotel. Nothing outstanding
data.text:
Rooms are simple but nice. Nothing great to highlight. I expected something better from this but is not bad.
It has a Starbucks in the lobby what is comfortable to have breakfast and even lunch and dinner.
Is quite well located, at walking distance to downtown.

owner_response.author: Mr_E_Guzman, Manager at Courtyard Ogden, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear rp316528,

Thank you for sharing your experience at the Courtyard Ogden.

We are delighted to hear you had a pleasant stay and enjoyed our Hotel amenities; we are located in the heart of Ogden with Historical 25th street a block away and the Salomon center nearby for fun activities. As a Valued Guest, your feedback will be shared with the team as this helps us improve our operations.

Thank you for staying at the Courtyard Ogden and we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Ogden.

Sincerely,
Ivan Toca
Assistant General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice stay but noisy
data.text:
Pros: centrally located, close to ski resorts, clean, spacious and comfortable room, microwave & fridge. Close to restaurants and cinema. Comfortable bedding

Cons: walls thin, can hear air con in room next door. Charger on clock outdated so couldn't charge iPhone 6.

data.title: Very good, and very different, and no a/c
data.text: This was obviously a different hotel that got renovated to become a Courtyard.  My experience would say that it was a Holiday Inn at one point.  Very good rooms and service, BUT!!  No a/c once they've switched to the winter season mode.  Basically, once they go from cooling to heating or vice versa, thats it.  A rather warm spell left me somewhat uncomfortable in a 73 degree room with no A/C.

owner_response.author: Mr_E_Guzman, Manager at Courtyard Ogden, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear DLPlatinum,

Thank you for sharing your experience at the Courtyard Ogden.

As a Valued Guest, we appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. I do apologize for the lack of A/C, our Hotel has a two pipe system and although we try our best to maintain a level of comfort for our guests it can be challenging during this season when temperatures change. We continue to look for ways to improve our system in order to provide our guests with a comfortable stay.

Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!

Sincerely,
Ivan Toca
Assistant General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great location near 25th Street and nice as Courtyards usually are.
data.text: Staying here was perfect for hanging out on 25th Street where you can enjoy the restaurants, live music and dive bars. You only have to walk across the parking lot to get there. The room was nice as usual. This one had an updated décor or at least different and I liked it. The staff was nice and allowed us to check in a bit early. I'm pretty sure we'll stay again. We had a great time! Next time we might even check out the gun museum.

data.title: Wonderful Hotel
data.text: My friend and I were in Ogden for one day only and wanted to be in the center of town so we treated ourselves to a more expensive hotel than we usually stay in and loved it.  The beds and pillows were so comfortable, we felt very pampered. There is also a nice snack deli in the lobby and the hotel is within walking distance of movies, restaurants and shopping.

data.title: Newly remodeled since my last visit
data.text:
I always enjoy staying the Courtyard by Marriott in Ogden because the staff is so grateful that you wanted to stay with them. They seem to go out of their way to make sure that your experience with them is one that you will not soon forget. 

This hotel has lots of meeting rooms that can be set up to accommodate several types of meetings or dinner/lunch meetings. 

The price for the stay is very reasonable as well. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the wireless network is strong and the workout facility has new equipment for your added pleasure. 

Located just 45 minutes from the Salt Lake City Airport it's a wonderful drive through the valley and gives you time to reflect on your time away from home. 

You can even take the train from the Airport to Ogden and then take the shuttle or UBER  from the train station to the hotel.

data.title: Great by Courtyard Standards
data.text: I recently stayed at the Courtyard in Ogden, and very much enjoyed my stay. The hotel is reasonably priced, and located in downtown with many nearby restaurants. The views are simply breathtaking, and the rooms were up to date. Very nice stay.

data.title: Great hotel in Historic Ogden
data.text: We stayed here on our way to Yellowstone and Grand Tetons.  Wonderful location in historic Ogden.   We already booked to stay on our way back and spend a few extra days.   Friendly staff and clean rooms.  Highly recommend!

data.title: Beautiful & Clean
data.text: Checking in was quick and the staff was very friendly. This hotel is quite far from Provo and Salt Lake City. The bathroom was nice and white and Clean! The room was very spacious. There is a small fridge and microwave in the room. The couch is also a pull out. My only problem was the TV stand as screwed into and area blocking the VGA hook up so I could not do my work. I tried to go down stairs to connect to the business center computers but those do not have a monitor mode. Other than that, this hotel was nice and clean!!

data.title: Comfy rooms
data.text:
I have stayed at this same property for years. Not sure when it changed to Courtyard from full service Marriott but it is great. I love getting points instead of having my room cleaned. I request extra towels in my Marriott profile so I always have plenty even if I do not have maid service for 2-3 days. The free Starbucks for being a platinum member is good.
My only comment is the Starbucks should be open later during the morning.
I tried to grab a 2nd coffee at 10:30AM and they were shut down for the morning service. 
Good location, easy to walk to conf in the Perry Theatre.

data.title: An extra for business trip
data.text: The location is really great to the famous 25th st and the Wall Ave. If you are in a business trip, this location will help you have a nice walk to really cute places, restaurants and stores and the Union Station Museum, so you can really have a time off after work.

data.title: Wonderful Location
data.text: Great Check in , and the room was as expected. Everything is within walking distance.    They gave me great directions on what to explore in Ogden.   Lovely town with some cool old bars to explore.  Great area to stay just above SLC

data.title: BEST COURTYARD MARRIOTT WE'VE SEEN
data.text:
LOVE this hotel. Nicest Courtyard either my husband or I have ever been to. Next time we go to the Tetons/Yellowstone we'll definitely stay here again, so thank you.

VIEW - Awesome!  We were on the 6th flr facing north - great view of the mtns, old court house, Mormon church trumpeting angel, etc.  

LOBBIES - huge...  and there are several (main, lounge, business ctr, bistro). You could spend your spare time in the lobbies w/TV's & just rent a bed & bathroom to sleep in!  

BEDROOM - VERY clean, possibly new?  Great use of space, outlets are all off the floor & attached to each lighting fixture or under wall-mounted TV.  (TV is small for today's standards but you can always go back to the lounge/lobby.)  Very comfortable sofa & lots of room to relax & walk around.  Best of all - THE BED WAS NICE & FIRM. Most comfortable night's sleep @ the end of an 8-day vacation.  Room décor is streamlined or "state of the art" as Marriott calls it - not my taste but it's a business hotel.  VERY spacious, nice size mini fridge & microwave are out of view.  

BATHROOM - nice size shower with great water pressure!!  

BISTRO - breakfast choices were nice (not free @ Courtyards) + Starbucks. They even offered dinner here, which is a great idea for Courtyards.  (Kinda silly for this one, you're 1 block north of a street with a dozen restaurants!)

BASEBALL FAN??  1 block from Lindquist Field, home of the a Dodgers minor league team, Ogden Raptors.  Can see the scoreboard from the room we were in, $6 general admission.  Be sure to sit in the comfy firepit lounge chairs outside the pool for a nice way to end the evening w/a free fireworks show from the baseball field every Friday!  (Who knew that Lasorda, Buckner, Garvey & Valentine were all on this team in 1968??)

Will stay here again to & from the SLC airport as we visit the National Parks again.  

Whoever ranked this 3 or below must have had bad service or stayed in a room that wasn't renovated.  We were totally impressed.

data.title: Very Nice Two Night Stay
data.text: I stayed on the eighth floor, in a king room on business.  The room was recently renovated, and both the bed and couch was very comfortable.  I did not have any of the room temperature issues others wrote about, the thermostat worked just fine during these hot days in early August.  The fitness room is better than most:  large, plenty of treadmills and elliptically, free weights, and yoga mats.  The breakfast at the Bistro is delivered very fast after ordering, which was helpful, since I had to rush to a meeting.  I have stayed here in the past, and I will come back.

Thank you for staying at the Courtyard Ogden and we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Ogden.


Sincerely,

data.title: Ogden Courtyard
data.text: Hotel was nice, large facility. Good size rooms, however the air conditioning didn't really work. I asked about it and was told because they bought out another Hotel it hadn't been upgraded. Our room was facing a parking lot and was quite loud over the weekend late at night.

owner_response.author: Mr_E_Guzman, Manager at Courtyard Ogden, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear love2travelkim,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience regarding your recent stay at the Courtyard Ogden. The Hotel is equipped with a two pipe system; we are slowly upgrading the system and improving the temperature of some of the affected rooms, the reason for this taking some time is due to the age of the hotel and finding the components for improvements. We appreciate you sharing your feedback; our team is working on improvements to ensure our guests can have a comfortable stay. Your feedback is important to us as it gives us the opportunity to improve our operations.

Thank you for staying with us and we hope to have the opportunity to be your host on your next visit to Ogden.


Sincerely,
Ivan Toca
Assistant General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Average and unsatisfactory room cleaning services
data.text: What's the minimum you expect from a hotel stay, you rooms be cleaned and the coffee cups and toiletry items are replenished. I came back after work to see none of this was done. Don't the cleaning staff have a check-list ? Seriously? I would like the hotel manager to speak with his/her staff and educate them on the basic stuff. Not acceptable from a reputed hotel chain, not for the hundreds of dollars I pay everyday to stay there. What a serious lapse. On the positive side, the lobby looks super fancy and the front desk staff were helpful and friendly. I've read other reviews about bad room cleaning service, but I wished it was a one time or once in a blue moon issue

owner_response.author: Mr_E_Guzman, Manager at Courtyard Ogden, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Prajod I,

Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Courtyard Ogden.

Room Cleanliness and service is one of our top rated areas in our surveys and guest comments; I am very sorry to learn that we missed this key area during your stay. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the team in an effort to improve our operations.

data.title: Courtyard Ogden
data.text: Nice hotel. Strange sewer like smell upon arrival in the hall and elevator but did dissipate.  In need of new carpet in major walkways outside of the room. Room was standard. Has a small refrigerator and a microwave.  Pull out sofa bed. King size bed.  Close to many restaurants and lots of free parking at the hotel.

data.title: Quick stop through Utah
data.text: Driving through for a quick good night sleep and this was a Bingo.  Walk just a few hundred yards to a great spot with lots of great restaurants.   Staff is wonderful.  Bed SUPER comfy.  Note:  No fresh coffee until 7 a.m.  They were very nice and provided me a fresh cup at 6:30.   Location is easy for on and off freeway access.

data.title: Marriott courtyard Ogden.
data.text: Coffee service in room was poor. Cleaning schedule was very late for guests staying more than one day. No bath tubs. Is this the norm now? Staff was friendly and Starbucks was willing to get us coffee early because we had none in our room. Very clean and comfortable and good location.

owner_response.author: Mr_E_Guzman, Manager at Courtyard Ogden, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Patricia M,

Thank you for sharing your experience regarding your recent stay at the Courtyard Ogden.

As a valued guest, we see that there is room for improvement based on your feedback. We will share your feedback with our team regarding the cleaning schedule and coffee in the room. Our guests can call the front desk for additional coffee and our team will be happy to replenish the coffee in the room, for future reference you can request a bath tub in the room, we are limited but can ensure we assign a bath tub when requested.

I am glad you had a great experience with our staff, they do a great job taking care of our guests and we hope to have the opportunity to be your host on your next visit to Ogden.

Sincerely,
Ivan Toca
Assistant General Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Staff in the Courtyard Brand
data.text:
The staff at this Courtyarf deserve pay raises. They are exceptionally trained, very courteous and extremely thoughtful. The staff went out of their way to make my family feel at home in the hotel.
It just so happens we had a few kids get sick in the night which dampened plans for the following day. The staff sent get well cards for the kids along with amenities to help pass the time while sick.
Awesome job!!!!!!!!!
